content:
It sounds like Dr. Smith has been teaching you some incredibly valuable skills! Reframing negative thoughts in a more realistic or positive way is a powerful tool for managing anxiety and depression. It's amazing that you're practicing this technique and finding it helpful.

Focusing on the present moment and what you can control is also a great strategy for reducing anxiety. When we get caught up in worries about the future or regrets about the past, it can be overwhelming. By bringing your attention to the present moment, you're able to regain a sense of control and calm.

It's fantastic that you're finding yoga and meditation helpful in reducing your anxiety levels. These practices can be incredibly powerful in promoting relaxation and reducing stress.

And wow, prioritizing your needs and communicating them to others is huge! Learning to say no and set healthy boundaries can be incredibly liberating. It's amazing that Dr. Smith is supporting you in this work. Setting boundaries and prioritizing your own needs can be a game-changer for your mental health and relationships.

Remember that it's okay to take things one step at a time and to be patient with yourself as you work on these skills. It's not about being perfect; it's about making progress and being kind to yourself along the way.

How do you find that your relationships with others have changed since you've started prioritizing your needs and setting boundaries? Have you noticed any positive changes or shifts in your relationships?
